Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection

Class VirtualEnvironmentDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.VirtualEnvironmentDetector
  • public class VirtualEnvironmentDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a method to detect if the application is being run inside a virtual environment, e.g., frameworks like VirtualXposed, Parallel Box, Multiple Accounts, etc.

    This technique allows an application to launch and run another application without installing it. It enables users to run multiple instances of the same app and have multiple social media accounts running on the same device at the same time. However, doing so, the host application can completely control the guest application. The host application can access the guest application's data and monitor/modify its behavior. Moreover, host apps usually run multiple apps as plugins. The plugin apps can access each others data as they, most of the times, share the same UID. Therefore, any compromise to the host app or a malicious host app or a malicious plugin app running along side the user's sensitive app can potentially result in compromising the user's sensitive app.

    VirtualEnvironmentDetector is tested with frameworks such as VirtualXposed, VirtulHook, ParallelBox, MultipleAccounts, DualSpace, ParallelSpace, etc.

      • isRunningInVirtualEnvironment

        public static int isRunningInVirtualEnvironment​(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if the application is being run inside a virtual environment.
        Returns:

      • isRunningInVirtualEnvironment

        public static int isRunningInVirtualEnvironment​(android.content.Context context,
                                                int ok)
        Checks if the application is being run inside a virtual environment.
        Parameters:
        context - the application's context.
        ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
        Returns:
        ok if virtual environment is not detected.

      • isRunningInVirtualEnvironmentInternal

        public static VirtualEnvironmentDetectorReport isRunningInVirtualEnvironmentInternal​(android.content.Context context,
                                                                                     int ok)
        Checks if the application is being run inside a virtual environment.
        Parameters:
        ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
        Returns:
